LABELS.PASS-PLACEHOLDER: Your email identifier (read Getting Started to set one)

STARTED.INTRO-LINE-1: If you are new to mining, this is the place for you.
STARTED.INTRO-LINE-2: take a deep breath, its only confusing at first but pure joy once up and running

FIRST.STEP-1: Both online wallets and hardware wallets have their pros and cons:
FIRST.STEP-2: MyMonero is an online wallet maintained by the core monero team, so while safe is still suceptable to hacks.
FIRST.STEP-3: Free Wallet Monero is an online/mobile wallet created by third parties, suceptable to hacks.
FIRST.STEP-4: Monero GUI Wallet The safest way to safely store and secure your XMR, although it would be your responsibility to kee your XMR Safe

SECOND.STEP-INTRO-2: Choose the miners according to your Hardware:
SECOND.STEP-FINAL: The files are compressed with 7zip and the password is : cryptominers.cl
SECOND.STEP-NOTE: Note: Some antivirus may flag this file as a 'virus'. because some malware install miners on your pc without your consent. (just whitelist this file on your antivirus/firewall)

THIRD.STEP-INTRO: Third step   : Pick a server and port
THIRD.STEP-INTRO-2: There are 2 important things here the URL and the port that you are going to connect to
THIRD.STEP-1:
You need to pick your URL and Port from the Ports List. Here you'll notice theres Global, PPLNS, Solo (?)

Global is simply a collection of both PPLNS & Solo ports powerd by GEODNS.
GEODNS automagically finds the closest server to you and could also be used to shares you in case of a regional outage.

If you prefer to shave off a few of those ms and connect directly, you have the option to select your preferred endpoint too.

The Port is used in conjunciton with the url and is used to specify the starting difficulty. You should select this depending on the total #ing power of your rig (see port descriptions).

If you are an advanced user or would like to set a fixed difficulty. examples below.

ALLTOGETHER.INTRO-2: OK So by now you should have a wallet, mining software, url and port. Its time to put them together.
ALLTOGETHER.TODO:
Here are some examples of the parameters that you need to pass on to your miner software, the format matters so be careful.

Depending on your miner you need to add the required parameters via command line or config.txt

Required fields are payment address and MinerIdentifier

WELCOME-PAGE.EXAMPLE-TEXT-1: Our tuned XMR-STAK software should look like this once is running:

POOLSTATS.WEEKLYFOUNDTT: Weekly average to find a Block in the network (more KH/s increase this value)
POOLSTATS.DAYTOFOUND: Avg. Days to find a block
POOLSTATS.DAYTOFOUNDTT: Probability to found a block in days
POOLSTATS.REWARDDAILYTT: An estimated amount of how much XMR the pool should get daily.
